children.name: hospital
children.definition: a large building where sick or injured people are looked after and receive medical treatment:bệnh viện
examples: Lucy works as a nurse at the local hospital.
be in hospitalUK/be in the hospitalUS being treated in a hospital
I was in hospital for eight weeks after the accident.
a psychiatric hospital(alsoa mental hospitalold-fashioned) (= for people with mental illnesses )He was admitted to a secure psychiatric hospital.
a children’s hospitalan important children’s hospital
a maternity hospitalBritish English(= for women having babies )Many maternity hospitals have been forced to close.
a general hospital[a large hospital which dealswith all types of ill people] bệnh viện đa khoa
go to hospitalBritish English,go to the hospitalAmerican English The pain got worse and she had to go to the hospital.
be taken/rushed/airlifted to hospitalBritish English,be taken/rushed/airlifted to the hospitalAmerican English Three people were taken to hospital after a crash on the motorway.
be admitted to hospitalBritish English,be admitted to the hospitalAmerican English He was admitted to hospital suffering from chest pain.
leave/come out of hospitalBritish English,leave/come out of the hospitalAmerican English Her mother never left the hospital.

be discharged/released from hospitalBritish English,be discharged/released from the hospitalAmerican English(= be allowed to leave a hospital because you are better )It was several weeks before he was released from hospital.
hospital treatment/careWhat do older people think of hospital care?
a hospital stay(= the period someone spends in hospital )New surgical techniques mean a hospital stay of less than 48 hours.
a hospital bedThere is a shortage of hospital beds.
a hospital ward/roomnurses working on hospital wards

children.name: medical center
children.definition: USa large hospital, which often has many different departments, including areas for research :trung tâm y tế
examples: a discovery by doctors at the New England Medical Center
Frank is being treated at Valley Medical Center with minor injuries.
The test is expensive and available only at certain medical centers.

children.name: clinic
children.definition: a place, often in a hospital, where medical treatment and advice is given to people who do not need to stay in a hospital :phòng khám
examples: a family-planning clinic(= which gives people help and advice about birth control )
a special clinic for people with drug and alcohol problems
types of clinic
a health/medical clinicTest results from a health clinic are available in about three weeks.
a hospital clinicYou can be tested for infection at a special hospital clinic.
a family planning clinic(= giving advice about how to prevent pregnancy )There are family planning clinics all over the country.
an antenatal clinicBritish English(= giving medical care to pregnant women )The staff at the antenatal clinic will give you the results of your blood test.
a fertility clinic(= helping people to become pregnant )We scheduled an appointment at the fertility clinic.
a dental clinic(= treating problems with teeth )a specialist dental clinic
an outpatient clinic(= for someone who does not need to stay in hospital )There's an outpatient clinic for people with diabetes.
a private clinic(= not paid for by the government )Fees at private clinics are usually very high.
a local clinicShe's involved in health care education at a local clinic.
go to a clinic(alsoattend a clinicformal)Pregnant women should attend an antenatal clinic at least once a month.
hold a clinic(= arrange for a clinic to take place )The hospital holds vaccination clinics once a fortnight.
clinic staffClinic staff are hopeful that Stephen will make a full recovery.

children.name: unit
children.definition: a part of a hospital where a particular type of medical problem is treated: khoa
examples: Funding has been approved for a 40-bed unit for the elderly at Aberdare General Hospital.
coronary/psychiatric/intensive care etc unit
A new psychiatric unit will be added to the John F. Kennedy Medical Center.
She's in the burns/paediatric/psychiatric unit.

children.name: ward
children.definition: a large room in a hospital or a part of a hospital where a group of patients with similar medical conditions have their beds: khu
examples: Linda is a doctor in a ward for premature babies.
psychiatry/maternity/pediatric etc ward
When her baby was due, Barbara was admitted to the maternity ward of Mercy Hospital.
on/in the ward
a young nurse in her first day on the wards
the other patients in the ward.

children.name: health service
children.definition: a public service which provides medical treatment : dịch vụ y tế
examples: reforms to the health service

children.name: healthcare
children.definition: the set of services provided by a country or an organization for the treatment of the physically and the mentally ill : dịch vụ y tế
examples: Healthcare workers are some of the lowest paid people in the country.

children.name: operating room
children.definition: operating theatreUK(abbOR)US a special room in which people are operated on in a hospital : phòng mổ
examples: Mrs Barnett was in the operating theatre for 11 hours while the transplant was carried out.

children.name: delivery room
children.definition: a room in a hospital in which babies are born : phòng sanh

children.name: outpatient
children.definition: ngoại trú
examples: outpatient clinic/departmenta part of a hospital where people come in for treatment, although they do not stay at the hospital :
Two outpatient clinics in the area are offering drug treatment programs.

children.name: emergency room
children.definition: casualty (department)(abbA&E)UK /emergencyroom/(abbER) US  the part of a hospital you go to for emergency treatment, for example if you have had an accident or if you suddenly become very ill: phòng cấp cứu
examples: He arrived in casualty with multiple injuries to his head.
Thorpe was treated in the casualty department at Middlesborough General.
Emergency room doctors tried to save Ryan’s life.
A&E waiting times have gone down.
A 33-year-old man was brought to the emergency room in a coma.

children.name: intensive care
children.definition: / intensive care unit the part of a hospital which provides intensive care : khu săn sóc đặc biệt
examples: He nearly died in the accident and wasinintensive care for over a month.
Mr Dye is in intensive care with head injuries.

children.name: sickroom
children.definition: a room in which someone who is ill lies in bed : phòng bệnh

children.name: in a school or on a ship
sickbay
children.definition: a room with beds for people who are ill, especially on a ship : bệnh xá trên tàu

children.name: infirmary
children.definition: US In the US, an infirmary is a room in a school, college or university where students who are injured or feeling ill can go to a nurse for treatment. : phòng y tế (trường)

children.name: the WHO
children.definition: the World Health OrganizationTổ chức y tế thế giới
examples: noun[ S + sing/pl verb ](abbreviationthe WHO)
a department of the United Nations which aims to improve health all over the world and limit the spread of diseases

children.name: the NHS
children.definition: the National Health Servicenoun (abbreviation)
examples: mạng lưới chăm sóc sức khoẻmiễn phído chính phủAnh thành lập từnăm 1948
the British service which provides free or cheap medical
treatment for everyone and is paid for by taxation
_Can you get acupunctureon(= paid for by) the National Health Service?
the NHSnoun[ S ]
abbreviation forthe National Health Service
_Many forms of cosmetic surgery are notavailable on(= paid for by) the NHS.
National Healthadjective(alsoNHS)
_a National Health hospital
_Is your dentist private or NHS?
NHSadjective
_an NHS hospital

children.name: Medicare
children.definition: nounchương trình của chính phủ Mỹ về việc chăm sóc người già trên 65 tuổi
examples: a government service in theUSwhich allows people aged 65 and over to receive medical treatment both in and out of hospitals

children.name: Medicaid
children.definition: nounchươngtrình chămsóc sức khỏe do Chính phủHoa Kỳtài trợ
examples: a government service in theUSwhich allows poor people to receive medical treatmentboth in and out of hospitals

children.name: blood bank
children.definition: a cool place where blood is stored before it is used in hospitals : ngân hàng máu

children.name: sperm bank
children.definition: : a place in which human sperm is stored in order to be used by doctors to try to make women pregnant ngân hàng tinh trùng

children.name: a place to be treated by a docter
surgery
children.definition: / office UK a place where you can go to ask advice from or receive treatment from a doctor or dentist : phòng khám bệnh
examples: If you come to the surgery at 10.30, the doctor will see you then.
On Saturday mornings, surgery (= the fixed period of opening of the place where you can go to see your doctor) is ( USoffice hoursare) from 9.00 to 12.00.

children.name: the doctor's
children.definition: the place where a doctor, especially a GP , works : phòng khám
examples: Hewent tothe doctor's this morning for a checkup.
‘Where’s Karen?’ ‘She’s at the doctor’s.’

children.name: mental institution
children.definition: / institution formal a hospital for mentally ill people - use this especially when you do not think this is a good place for sb to be treated: viện tâm thần
examples: Sally spent several years in an institution.
Psychiatrists argue that closing down mental institutions will lead to more homeless people on our streets.
psychiatric hospital[C] a hospital for mentally ill people. Psychiatric hospital is more technical than mental hospital:bệnh viện tâm thần
Humphrey is in a state psychiatric hospital after being convicted of beating his grandmother.
The judge will decide whether Barry will be sent to prison or a psychiatric hospital.
mental hospital[C]bệnh viện tâm thần
Shirley spent most of her adult life in a mental hospital.
At the age of 19 Greg had a nervous breakdown and had to be admitted to a mental hospital.
commit sb to a mental hospital
Knapman was committed to a mental hospital in August.

children.name: hospice
children.definition: a special hospital where people who are dying are looked after: bệnh viện cho người hấp hối
examples: Mary, who was suffering from terminal cancer, spent her last few months in a hospice.
They are hoping to raise funds to build a hospice for sick and dying children.

children.name: nursing home
children.definition: / old people's home a place where people who are old and ill can live and be looked after, by nurses : viện dưỡng lão
examples: She doesn't want to end up in a nursing home.

children.name: sanatorium
children.definition: a place where people recovering after a long illness were sent in the past, so that they could rest and receive special care : viện điều đưỡng
examples: He was sent to a sanatorium in the Swiss Alps.
